# aci_firewall_policy #

Manages ACI Firewall Policy

  -> For more information about the Firewall Policy, refer to the [Cisco ACI Virtual Edge Configuration Guide](https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/dcn/aci/aci-virtual-edge/3x/Configuration/cisco-aci-virtual-edge-configuration-guide-32x/Cisco-ACI-Virtual-Edge-Configuration-Guide-32x_chapter_distributed_firewall.html)


## API Information ##

* Class: [nwsFwPol](https://pubhub.devnetcloud.com/media/model-doc-latest/docs/app/index.html#/objects/nwsFwPol/overview)

* Supported in ACI versions: 1.1(1j) and later.

* Distinguished Name Format: `uni/infra/fwP-{name}`

## GUI Information ##

* Location: `Access Policies -> Policies -> Interface -> Firewall`

## Example Usage ##

The configuration snippet below creates a Firewall Policy with only required attributes.

```hcl

resource "aci_firewall_policy" "example" {
  name = "test_name"
}

```
The configuration snippet below shows all possible attributes of the Firewall Policy.

!> This example might not be valid configuration and is only used to show all possible attributes.

```hcl

resource "aci_firewall_policy" "full_example" {
  annotation  = "annotation"
  description = "description_1"
  mode        = "disabled"
  name        = "test_name"
  name_alias  = "name_alias_1"
  owner_key   = "owner_key_1"
  owner_tag   = "owner_tag_1"
  annotations = [
    {
      key   = "key_0"
      value = "value_1"
    }
  ]
  tags = [
    {
      key   = "key_0"
      value = "value_1"
    }
  ]
}

```

All examples for the Firewall Policy resource can be found in the [examples](https://github.com/CiscoDevNet/terraform-provider-aci/tree/master/examples/resources/aci_firewall_policy) folder.

## Schema ##

### Required ###

* `name` (name) - (string) The name of the Firewall Policy object.

### Read-Only ###

* `id` - (string) The distinguished name (DN) of the Firewall Policy object.

### Optional ###

* `annotation` (annotation) - (string) The annotation of the Firewall Policy object. This attribute is supported in ACI versions: 3.2(1l) and later.
  - Default: `"orchestrator:terraform"`
* `description` (descr) - (string) The description of the Firewall Policy object.
* `mode` (mode) - (string) The mode of the Firewall Policy object. Do not change the mode from 'disabled' directly to 'enabled'. Doing so can lead to traffic loss. Instead, from 'disabled' mode, change the mode to 'learning', wait 5 minutes, and then change the mode to 'enabled'. Changing to 'learning' mode allows Cisco ACI Virtual Edge to add flow table entries for existing flows.
  - Default: `"learning"`
  - Valid Values: `"disabled"`, `"enabled"`, `"learning"`.
* `name_alias` (nameAlias) - (string) The name alias of the Firewall Policy object. This attribute is supported in ACI versions: 2.2(1k) and later.
* `owner_key` (ownerKey) - (string) The key for enabling clients to own their data for entity correlation.
* `owner_tag` (ownerTag) - (string) A tag for enabling clients to add their own data. For example, to indicate who created this object.
* `annotations` - (list) A list of Annotations (ACI object [tagAnnotation](https://pubhub.devnetcloud.com/media/model-doc-latest/docs/app/index.html#/objects/tagAnnotation/overview)). Annotations can also be configured using a separate [aci_annotation](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/CiscoDevNet/aci/latest/docs/resources/annotation) resource. This attribute is supported in ACI versions: 3.2(1l) and later.
  #### Required ####
  
    * `key` (key) - (string) The key used to uniquely identify this configuration object.
    * `value` (value) - (string) The value of the property.
* `tags` - (list) A list of Tags (ACI object [tagTag](https://pubhub.devnetcloud.com/media/model-doc-latest/docs/app/index.html#/objects/tagTag/overview)). Tags can also be configured using a separate [aci_tag](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/CiscoDevNet/aci/latest/docs/resources/tag) resource. This attribute is supported in ACI versions: 3.2(1l) and later.
  #### Required ####
  
    * `key` (key) - (string) The key used to uniquely identify this configuration object.
    * `value` (value) - (string) The value of the property.

## Importing

An existing Firewall Policy can be [imported](https://www.terraform.io/docs/import/index.html) into this resource with its distinguished name (DN), via the following command:

```
terraform import aci_firewall_policy.example uni/infra/fwP-{name}
```

Starting in Terraform version 1.5, an existing Firewall Policy can be imported
using [import blocks](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/import) via the following configuration:

```
import {
  id = "uni/infra/fwP-{name}"
  to = aci_firewall_policy.example
}
```
